snippet: Officials, using data from birth certificates, said there were 3.93 million births in 2013, down slightly from 3.95 million in 2012.
abstract: National Center for Health Statistics reports there were 3.93 million births in United States in 2013, down slightly from 3.95 million in 2012; rate declines for sixth consecutive year, with sluggish economy being possible factor.
lead_paragraph: Officials, using data from birth certificates, said there were 3.93 million births in 2013, down slightly from 3.95 million in 2012.

headline.main: U.S. Birthrate Declines for Sixth Consecutive Year; Economy Could Be Factor
headline.print_headline: U.S. Birthrate Declines for Sixth Consecutive Year; Economy Could Be Factor
